body_html: well that would be solved in a much more readable way if we had annotations for inputs of our nodes (not even represented in the IR, just as a thing that the pretty-printer can read). I'm curious how would you imagine solving the loop problem if we can't have nested tuples. I'd imagine it would be something like (trip_count=%1, cond=%2, carry1=%3, carry2=%4). Is that right?

body: well that would be solved in a much more readable way if we had annotations for inputs of our nodes (not even represented in the IR, just as a thing that the pretty-printer can read). I'm curious how would you imagine solving the loop problem if we can't have nested tuples. I'd imagine it would be something like `(trip_count=%1, cond=%2, carry1=%3, carry2=%4)`. Is that right?
